reviews.text: Beautifully re-done. Clean and Charming. European-style continental breakfast. Reasonable price. Great location. Will definitely go back again.
reviews.title: Charming European Style
Loved the Hotel!
reviews.text: We have just returned from a weekend at the Savoy Hotel in San Francisco. The hotel is magnificent and the staff provides excellent sevice. The rooms are quaint, and the beds are very comfortable (including egypitian cotton sheets that are very soft). They have a complimentary wine and cheese event during the late afternoon. I would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends!

reviews.title: Spectacular Stay
reviews.text: Spent a couple midweek nights at the Savoy and loved it. Great service and wonderful accommodations. The rooms have a European sensibility - Efficient space without sacrificing comfort or elegance. Short walks to fine dining, happening night-life, and great shopping. Strongly recommend.
We stayed here for 3 nights after skiing in Lake Tahoe. The hotel is very well located, only a few blocks from Union Square (where most of the big shops are & the nearest cable car/tram).
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Lovely hotel!
reviews.text: There are 2 computers with free internet access and between 4 and 6pm there is free wine with cheese and crackers in the lobby - great to start you off before the big night!!

Paid $139 mid-week for a queen bed. Nice view of Geary Street, but also comes at the expense of street noise. The double-hung windows were only single-hung on one window frame section, allowing a lot of street noise to pass through.
reviews.title: Has old building character, and that's about it

reviews.text: I picked this recommendation from a highly-regarded source: Frommer's. Needless to say, it let me down. The building has old-time charm, but that's where it ends. Here's what I did notice: ongoing construction, construction crew using the one elevator that exists in the hotel, lack of standard amenities (room had only one working electrical outlet), door man that doesn't exists at most times of the day, bathroom which looks like it was remodeled/fixed on a shoestring budget (silicone caulking was abound throughout the tiles).
reviews.title: Could be worse

reviews.text: The wine reception between 4PM - 6PM is a nice touch, this is about the only shining area of the hotel's hospitality.
reviews.title: Excellent- For the Price

reviews.text: My two cents: Old charm, but that's it. One elevator, sacrifice of modern creature comforts in the bedrooms (i.e.: convenient electrical outlets, counter space in the bathrooms) must be dealt with. Management could definitely benefit if their staff would get out from behind the front desk and have more presence with their guests in the lobby and at the front door.
reviews.title: best room deal around
very happy
reviews.text: I stayed here on a Thursday night for $129 and the following Friday for $199. The hotel is a typical old european-style boutique hotel. They've spruced it up a bit but there's no getting around the fact that it's just an old hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed in a bay room (room with a bay window which I believe is supposed to be a step up from the standard room) for three nights at the beginning of our San Francisco trip and the furniture and decor was wonderful- Solid, dark wood desk with chair, queen sized bed, and small dresser/minifridge/TV stand combo. The room was sunny with hardwood floors (or laminate hardwood floors), a buttery paint color, and crisp white shutters. The double pane windows definitely helped cut out the street noise. There's a mini bottle of wine, along with a well-stocked minifridge with pleasantly decent prices. The hotel itself is absolutely lovely and charming- The service (with the rare exception of the initial person who checked us in, who was totally apathetic and was apparently too cool to be bothered to do her job with a smile) was great and the computer lounge above the lobby with high speed access and printer was also really useful.
reviews.title: Charming but a little disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay at The Savoy largely because of the Millenium Restaurant (my fiance is Vegan and I'm Vegan-friendly haha). We were happy overall with our stay but the following were some disappointments. Note that with a few exceptions, we probably wouldn't have been disappointed with their absence if we hadn't been expecting them, based on the hotel's statements on their website and from some of the reviews in travel books we read. Note also, that these comments may not apply to all rooms (but I guess the point is that they imply on their website that they DO apply to all rooms, even if they don't).
reviews.title: lovely stay in Savoy

reviews.text: The rooms are definitely SMALL (I think the bay room is supposed to be a little bigger than the smallest room, but I honestly can't imagine a room being smaller and still functional for more than one person). The location is very convenient to everything around Union Square but it's about a block or two further away from "the action" and that distance consists of a parking lot and some other areas that aren't necesarily bustling with activity so that it's a little intimidating to walk at night from the square up to the hotel since you have to walk about a black that's somewhat removed from the rest of the businesses closer to the center of Union Square. (check out my review of the Hotel Diva for other points of interest in the area, and for a discussion about the the pros and cons of the somewhat seedy area, if you want.)
reviews.title: Wonderful !
Pass on this one
reviews.text: The hallways definitely have a noticeable weird smell- Not necessarily unpleasant but difficult to pinpoint. Possibly like really really bad industrial air freshener. It doesn't follow you into the rooms though, so it's only noteworthy if you're particularly sensitive about smells. It didn't bother us and it probably won't bother you unless you're planning to spend a lot of time out in the hall. The place is old, which I appreciate. It's hard to age 92 years gracefully, but the hotel has largely done just that, with the help of some recent renovations. On the other hand, our bathroom was a little shabby and had a pretty unsightly mildew problem in the shower which was a little unsettling.

The following are things that were described as amenitites on the Savoy's website and/or in travel books (Fodor's) but we did not find to be true for our stay/room: there was no "chilled tequila shot" (not that this really bothered us since we're not big tequila fans but as an FYI to those of you would look forward to this); our "new Beautyrest" was so squeaky it was almost comical. Simply shifting in bed resulted in a chorus of embarrassing squeaks as the bed protested under our weight. And lest you chalk this up to the normal reaction of a helpless bed to a couple of overweight people, we're both pretty thin! The "400-thread count" sheets were pretty rough. In fact, I'm pretty sure that they weren't 400 thread count. Maybe they were but it just didn't feel like it because they were probably bleached to death but they didn't feel like they were even percale. There were also no "goose down comforters and pillows," just regular pillows and a typical mass chain hotel comforter. The ceiling fan was great (no air conditioner, which you almost never need in San Francisco) but a little noisy. There was also no bathrobe (as had been included as an amenity, by their website). Again, I'm sure the suites are super nice and contain all those amenities, and maybe our room was just a dud reserved for a couple of dusty looking "kids" (we're 27 and 28, respectively and both attorneys but we can look younger and scruffier, especially freed from our suits and on vacation) towing camping gear for a trip to Santa Cruz and Big Sur, but if you're expecting those amenities, I would just check with the hotel beforehand and see what to really expect if those things matter to you.
reviews.title: Great Location, Friendly Staff, Nice Hotel
One of the ten best small hotels
reviews.text: We were looking on the internet for a small charming hotel close to Union Square. We found the Savoy Hotel on Geary Street. Good, friendly reception; friendly doorman who did not hold out his hand for a tip. Colorful, clean carpets in the public areas. The room cheerful, apparently recently redecorated in diffeent shades of light and pleasant yellow. Expensive bedding, mattress and sheets. Ask for extra pillows. Two is not enough.

reviews.title: Savoy Hotel in San Fran is Wonderful!!
reviews.text: On the backside, you'll hear some traffic. Neither the mayor nor the police chief has stopped the bad habit of hanking horns.

reviews.title: Good deal
reviews.text: Overall, at about $ 110/night it's a very good value. We'll go back.
Aloha from Hawaii
reviews.title: Good for your travel budget

reviews.text: My friend and I recently travelled to San Francisco and stayed at the Savoy Hotel on Geary and Jones Streets. We were both very impressed. The Savoy is a charming hotel located on the edge of the Union Square area. The personnel are very customer service oriented, friendly and helpful. The hotel decor is very charming and they are continuing to do improvements to add more facilities. The rooms are decorated very nicely in somewhat of an art deco flavor. The rooms are a reasonable size, very clean and the best beds I have ever experienced in a hotel other than the Hotel Imperial in Vienna. The rooms are also very quiet when you are staying on a very busy street the double pane glass helps immensely. The hotel offers a very nice continental breakfast for $7.00 and a great wine and cheese Happy Hour from 4-6 pm or maybe it was 4-7, but very nice get together in their lobby. The location of the hotel is perfect, with easy access to Union Square shopping, Fisherman's Wharf and really any place you want to go in San Francisco. It was truly a wonderful hotel experience in every way!!
reviews.title: Average
Not up to Best Western standards
reviews.text: The first thing that hits you when you arrive is a weird fusty smell. I found this really off putting and it did make me wonder about cleanliness.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were pleasant and helpful and free internet access was a bonus. The location too was OK just a 10 minute walk from Union Square, although to be honest if I went to San Francisco again I would prefer to stay at the Wharf.
reviews.title: Hotel California makes my yearly Thanksgiving weekend with my brothers extra special.

reviews.text: The hotel is very old and desperately in neeed of renovation especially the bedrooms, lift and hallways. Our room had old mismatched furnituture. Also, most of the furniture and the bath and sink were badly damaged.
reviews.title: Great Art Deco Place

reviews.text: No room bar as noted by previous reviewers also no breakfast included but did get a free shot on arrival !
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second time we stayed at Hotel California and again we felt so at home...we have actually recommended it to our family and friend who have stayed there also through the year. We will return again. This last time we stayed in the Sun Room which was lovely. The staff is always so accommodating and friendly. I believe that is what makes us feel so at home there. We just love it.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: The Hotel California is perfect for those travellers who are more into getting out and about and seeing the sights, rather than sitting in a hotel room all day.
reviews.title: Cute and friendly boutique hotel
Very cute hotel
reviews.text: I was a single traveller, who was looking for comfort, value and location. Hotel California had all three.

The location is central, it is only about three blocks from Union Square, an easy walk, and from there you can catch the famous cable cars to Fisherman's Wharf etc. or do some serious shopping in Union Square! However I do not recommend walking on your own at night, as it is almost on the border of the Tenderloin area, so catch a cab at night (it isn't too far from anywhere), but other times it is fine and I felt perfectly safe walking around.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay!

likes.liked: — If you are an NEA member, use your Access discount! They have great rates!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I paid US$125 a night and was pleasantly surpised by the room (double bed) and the Hotel. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but they are clean and comfortable and have everything you need to for a good night's sleep. There is a bit of street noise, and noise from the outside hallway from other guests, however it is no worse than any other hotel in the city and ear plugs will fix that anyway!
reviews.title: Nice time at the Savoy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have a free wine and cheese reception from 4pm and this is the perfect way to either start your night or just relax and watch the world go by and unwind after a busy day sightseeing.
reviews.title: Savoy, soon to be Hotel California, clean and charming, just no water pressure

likes.liked: — Free wine and cheese at 4pm every day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I saw some of the reviews and was a bit concerned, but our stay at the Hotel California was fine. My husband actually stayed there when it was the Savoy. We stayed in a Sun Room, which is an upgraded corner room. Cute decor, Comfy bed, windows that opened. TV, fridge, desk, wifi, small but nice bath. The room was very clean. The elevator is small, but I actually prefer the stairs for fitness. I sleep with earplugs normally so I slept like a rock. The location is fabulous! Right down the street from Union Square, Japan Town, there is a bart station close by, walked up to nob hill, had breakfast at Davids. Bellman and the gal at the desk were both very kind and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Classic Small Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint, if I can make one, is that the wifi was slow for transmitting large documents. If you need to work there, you might want to verify the internet connection.
reviews.title: Charming!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't try the restaurant but my SF friend told me that he heard of it, that people come to SF specifially to dine there.
reviews.title: quite alright

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a classic turn of the century San Fran hotel and a good value if you are trying to keep trip costs down. I felt like I was staying with a friend in the city! (I live in suburbia so this was cool!)
reviews.title: I would avoid this hotel. Period.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this gem of a find charming hotel when we went to San Francisco. We were looking for a cheap good place to stay. And to our luck, we found this place on the internet and check trip advisor, it seemed to be alright. As we drove up, the hotel is on Geary street (one way) and not being used to the streets we missed it a couple times. There is parking literally next door for $20 a day. We were welcomed with a welcome tequilla shot which was a great surprise! Once checked in, you take the antique elevator to your room. The girlfriend commented that this was the place she enjoyed staying in the most in SF.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: I have to admit that I was a little worried about staying at this hotel after reading some of the reviews but this really is a nice hotel. Now, don't expect anything fancy but if you're looking for a clean room with a central location in San Francisco, this is your place. Every evening there is a wine and cheese thing in the lobby which is a nice touch and the staff appear to be friendly. I stayed on the 2nd floor and there is some street noise but I live in London so I'm used to street noise but I can understand that some people would find this annoying. Overall, I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great value hotel and good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm sure we're not the first, but the main reason we stayed at The Hotel California was for the attached Millennium Restaurant, which is one of (if not the) best vegan restaurants in the world.
reviews.title: Good clean hotel with a fantastic restaurant
Mixed results
reviews.text: We stopped over in SF on our way to a skiing trip in Lake Tahoe so we needed somewhere easy to get to from the airport (we were driving) and where we could get out of the city first thing in the morning. Downtown SF is a few miles up the highway from the airport and Geary Street is easily accessed by car. (Just stear clear of Van Ness if you want to avoid the traffic...)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very clean, if a little dated. The rooms were nicely decorated and the beds comfortable. The bathroom was clean and had a good shower. As could be expected in downtown SF, there was noise at night, but no more than any other city I've stayed in. (Why do American cops find it necessary to use sirens in the middle of the night?!?)
reviews.title: Could have been better

reviews.text: The front desk staff were incredibly helpful, some of the best I've encountered anywhere.
reviews.title: Charming hotel, great location!
Atmosphere
reviews.text: After spending three nights late May 2010, found everything excellent. The old fashioned look to the rooms in no way detracts from the comfort and cleanliness. Service was excellent, from the doorman, room services and reception.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only one small comment. Would have been good to have a regular restaurant and bar on the premises.
reviews.title: Ended up loving it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: visitors from Oz
reviews.title: Excellent Value
Just perfect for me
reviews.text: I wanted to hate it when I first walked in. But the room was charming and the bed was so comfortable. Missed not having an ice machine on the floor but the bell captain was only a call away. Location, location, location.! A little disappointed that the hotel restaurant is vegetarian but gave it a chance and it was extremely good but $25 for pan fried polenta with some artichoke hearts? No A/C in the summer might be a bit tough but then again summer in SF is like spring anywhere else.

We stayed 5 fabulous days at this hotel. It's location is central to Union Square, the public transportation, streetcars, theatres, great restaurants and bars and galleries, and even the relative proximity to the Tenderloin region has its own strange and curious charm if you're a respectful and careful traveler and want to experience the 'real life' of this fabulous city.
reviews.title: Duane is simply the best ever!
